security: Sharing the details of Tepedino's interrogation, AMLASH's connections, and the handling of AMLASH's name in connection to the assassination investigation could reveal intelligence sources and methods.
summary: This document contains notes relating to Book V of the Church Committee report, referencing the CIA's interrogation of Tepedino regarding the AMLASH operation and Rolando Cubela's (AMLASH) connections, as well as the handling of AMLASH's name in the context of the JFK assassination investigation.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, related to "Book V" of the Church Committee report, discusses the CIA's 1965 interrogation of Tepedino, a New York jeweler involved in the AMLASH operation, where Tepedino was found to be deceptive about AMLASH's ties to Cuban intelligence and AMLASH's denial of plans to overthrow Castro. It also highlights that, following President Kennedy's assassination, Mexico City cabled AMLASH's name (Rolando Cubela) as a contact of Soviet personnel, yet key figures like Fitzgerald, Helms, Tom K, and Angleton did not inform the desk officer, John Whitten, of the significance of AMLASH's name.
title: Relating to "Book V" of Church Committee
